      • calcNumDays

        public static int calcNumDays(java.lang.String date)
        Calculate the number of days elapsed for a given date (e.g. 1998/2/2 - 32 days have elapsed in that year).
        Parameters:
        a - string representation of a date
        Returns:
        an int (-1 for error)

      • isValidTimeStamp

        public static boolean isValidTimeStamp(java.lang.String timeStamp)
        Verify that the input string is a valid timestamp value. timestamp is assumed to be in 'yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.fffff] format.
        Parameters:
        a - string representation of a timestamp
        Returns:
        true/false

      • trimExcessTimestampFraction

        public static java.lang.String trimExcessTimestampFraction(java.lang.String s)
        Informix only supports up to 5 digits in the fractions of a second field (frac(5)). So if we get one that has more digits, we have to truncate it.
        Parameters:
        a - string representation of a timestamp
        Returns:
        an Informix compliant timestamp

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true/false

        Given a valid date ('yyyy-mm-dd' format), calculate the julian day of that date.

      • isLeapYear

        public static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        Determine if the given year is a leap year or not. date is assumed to be in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format.
        Parameters:
        integer - representation of a year
        Returns:
        true/false

      • getLocaleValue

        public static java.util.Locale getLocaleValue(java.lang.String dateLocale)
        Determine the correct locale setting based on whether a server is a GLS server or not. If the server is a GLS server, then a locale will have been previously set and this value needs to be parsed for correct use in the various date formatting methods. If the server is not a GLS server then the locale will not have been previously set and in this case the default locale of the system will be used.
        Parameters:
        dateLocale - a string representation of the current client or database locale
        Returns:
        client locale value representation in format that is expected by date formatting methods.

      • convertNativeSQLDate

        public static java.lang.String convertNativeSQLDate(java.lang.String dateStr,
                                    IfxConnection conn)
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Determine the localized date format of a date string whose original representation was in NativeSQL JDBC escape format "yyyy-mm-dd'.
        Parameters:
        dateStr - - a string representation of a date in "yyyy-mm-dd" JDBC escape format.
        conn - - the current connection object.
        Returns:
        locdateStr - the localized date string representation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • convertNativeSQLDateTime

        public static java.lang.String convertNativeSQLDateTime(java.lang.String datetimeStr,
                                        IfxConnection conn,
                                        boolean isTime)
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Determine the localized datetime format of a datetime string whose original representation was in NativeSQL JDBC escape format 'yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.fffff]' (for datetime) or 'hh:mm:ss' (for time).
        Parameters:
        datetimeStr - - a string representation of a datetime in "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.fffff]" (for datetime) or "hh:mm:ss" (for time) JDBC escape format.
        conn - - the current connection object.
        isTime - - true represents java.sql.Time, false represents java.sql.Timestamp
        Returns:
        locdatetimeStr - the localized datetime string representation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • convertDateStr

        public static java.lang.String convertDateStr(java.sql.Date date,
                              IfxConnection conn)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Determine the localized date format of a date string based on a java.sql.Date object.
        Parameters:
        date - - java.sql.Date object representation
        conn - - the current connection object.
        Returns:
        locdateStr - the localized date string representation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • convertDateTimeStr

        public static java.lang.String convertDateTimeStr(java.util.Date datetime,
                                  IfxConnection conn,
                                  long value)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Determine the localized date format of a datetime/time string based on a java.sql.Timestamp/java.sql.Time object.
        Parameters:
        datetime - - java.sql.Timestamp or java.sql.Time object representation
        conn - - the current connection object.
        value - - long integer representation of datetime value.
        Returns:
        locdatetimeStr - the localized datetime string representation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
